statuses.label: Backlog
statuses.description: Stories identified but not yet refined. Requirements may be incomplete or need clarification.

statuses.label: Ready for Dev
statuses.description: Stories with complete acceptance criteria, ready for implementation. All requirements are clear.

statuses.label: In Progress
statuses.description: Currently being implemented. Developer is actively working on the code.

statuses.label: Review
statuses.description: Code complete, awaiting review. Changes need to be verified before merging.

statuses.label: Human Review
statuses.description: Awaiting human review and approval. Complete all checklist items before moving to Done.

statuses.label: Done
statuses.description: Implemented and verified. The story is complete and ready for deployment.

statuses.label: Optional
statuses.description: Nice-to-have features that are not required for the current release.

nextSteps.label: Create Epics & Stories
nextSteps.description: Break work into epics and stories

nextSteps.label: Check Readiness
nextSteps.description: Verify story is ready for development

analyst.whenToUse: At the start of a project to understand requirements, research competitors, or document an existing codebase.
examplePrompts: Help me brainstorm features for a task management app
Research the competitive landscape for project management tools
Document the architecture of this existing codebase

pm.whenToUse: After analysis to define product requirements, create user stories, and plan the project structure.
examplePrompts: Create a PRD for user authentication
Break this feature into epics and stories
Write acceptance criteria for the checkout flow

architect.whenToUse: After planning to design the system architecture, choose technologies, and create technical specifications.
examplePrompts: Design the database schema for user management
Create an architecture diagram for the microservices
Recommend a tech stack for this project

sm.whenToUse: During sprints to plan work, track progress, prepare stories for development, and run retrospectives.
examplePrompts: Generate the current sprint status
Prepare story 2.3 for development
Run a sprint retrospective

dev.whenToUse: When stories are ready for development, or when code needs review before merging.
examplePrompts: Implement story 1.2 following the acceptance criteria
Review the code changes for the auth feature
Add unit tests for the payment module

quick-flow-solo-dev.whenToUse: For bug fixes, small features, or quick enhancements that don't need full planning.
examplePrompts: Fix the login button not responding on mobile
Add a dark mode toggle to settings
Optimize the image loading performance

tea.whenToUse: When setting up testing infrastructure, writing E2E tests, or validating performance requirements.
examplePrompts: Set up the E2E testing framework
Generate E2E tests for the checkout flow
Validate the performance requirements

ux-designer.whenToUse: When designing user interfaces, creating wireframes, or validating UX requirements.
examplePrompts: Design the user onboarding flow
Create wireframes for the dashboard
Review the UX of the checkout process

tech-writer.whenToUse: When creating documentation, explaining complex concepts, or generating diagrams.
examplePrompts: Write API documentation for the user endpoints
Create a flowchart for the order process
Explain the authentication architecture

analysis.label: Analysis
analysis.description: Research, brainstorming, and understanding requirements. Document existing projects and explore market context.

workflows.label: Brainstorming
workflows.tooltip: Interactive session with the Analyst to explore ideas, features, and possibilities. Produces a brainstorming report that feeds into later planning steps.

workflows.label: Market Research
workflows.description: Market size, growth, competition, and customer insights
workflows.tooltip: Researches market size, growth potential, competitive landscape, and target customer insights. Helps validate your product idea against real market conditions.

workflows.label: Domain Research
workflows.description: Industry analysis, regulations, and ecosystem dynamics
workflows.tooltip: Deep dive into your project's industry domain: regulatory requirements, technology trends, ecosystem dynamics, and domain-specific constraints.

workflows.label: Technical Research
workflows.tooltip: Evaluates technology options, compares frameworks and tools, and analyzes implementation approaches to inform tech stack decisions.

workflows.label: Create Product Brief
workflows.tooltip: Creates a concise product brief capturing the project vision, target users, core value proposition, and high-level goals. Serves as the foundation for all subsequent planning.

planning.label: Planning
planning.description: Define product requirements, create epics and stories, and plan the project structure.

workflows.label: Create PRD
workflows.tooltip: The PM creates a detailed Product Requirements Document defining features, user flows, functional and non-functional requirements. The PRD drives all downstream architecture and story creation.

workflows.label: Edit PRD
workflows.tooltip: Opens the existing PRD for guided editing with the PM agent. Use this to refine requirements, add new features, or update scope after initial creation.

workflows.label: Validate PRD
workflows.tooltip: Reviews the PRD for completeness, consistency, and quality. Checks that all required sections are present, requirements are testable, and there are no contradictions.

workflows.label: Create UX Design
workflows.tooltip: Creates a UX specification with user flows, wireframe descriptions, and interface guidelines. Produces ux-spec.md that developers reference during implementation.

solutioning.label: Solutioning
solutioning.description: Design system architecture, create epics and stories, and verify implementation readiness.

workflows.label: Create Architecture
workflows.tooltip: Designs the system architecture: tech stack, component structure, data models, APIs, and integration patterns. Produces architecture.md that guides all implementation work.

workflows.label: Create Epics & Stories
workflows.description: Break work into epics and stories
workflows.tooltip: Breaks the PRD and architecture into epics (major feature groups) and individual stories with acceptance criteria. Creates the work items that populate the sprint board.

workflows.label: Check Implementation Readiness
workflows.description: Verify project is ready for development
workflows.tooltip: Reviews all planning artifacts (PRD, architecture, stories) to verify consistency, completeness, and readiness for implementation. Catches gaps before development begins.

management.label: Management
management.description: Sprint planning, progress tracking, retrospectives, and project documentation.

workflows.label: Sprint Planning
workflows.tooltip: The Scrum Master helps prioritize stories, estimate effort, and organize the next sprint. Selects which backlog stories to move into the sprint based on capacity and dependencies.

workflows.label: Sprint Status
workflows.tooltip: Generates a progress report of the current sprint: which stories are in progress, completed, or blocked. Updates the sprint-status.yaml tracking file.

workflows.label: Retrospective
workflows.tooltip: Facilitates a sprint retrospective to review what went well, what didn't, and what to improve. Documents learnings and action items for the next sprint.

workflows.label: Correct Course
workflows.tooltip: When a story or implementation has gone off-track, this workflow helps diagnose the issue and plan corrections. Use when code review reveals problems or requirements have changed.

workflows.label: Generate Project Context
workflows.tooltip: Generates a comprehensive project-context.md summarizing all planning artifacts into a single reference. AI agents use this during development to understand the full project scope.

workflows.label: Document Project
workflows.tooltip: The Tech Writer creates or updates project documentation including README, API docs, architecture overviews, and developer guides based on the current codebase state.
